creator_2: Citizen Watch Co. Ltd (Not indicated in Artist/Producer tab, but stated in SGCOOL Label and reflected on the item itself
physical_appearance: This watch belonging to Justice Choor Singh is irregular in shape and is silver in colour. Citizen is the brand manufacturer of this watch. The words 'CITIZEN AUTOMATIC' can be seen at the top of the watch's quadrant while the word '21JEWELS' can be seen at the bottom. 'LON 22' is displayed at the right hand side of the watch's quadrant
sgcool_label_text: Citizen brand watch, worn by Justice Choor Singh. Choor Singh was the first Indian to hold the position of Magistrate in Colonial Malaya, and was appointed as a judge of the Supreme Court of Singapore in 1963. Apart from an illustrious legal career, he made significant contributions to the Sikh community in Singapore. He was one of the founders of the Singapore Khalsa Association, and advocated the teaching of Punjabi in Singapore as the Chairman of the Sikh Advisory Board. He also authored several books on the Sikh religion and the Sikh community in Singapore.
title_text: Watch belonging to the late Justice Choor Singh
